results.title: Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
About NeuraFlash:

Our expertise spans across the Amazon ecosystem with Amazon Connect, Lex & Contact Lens and Salesforce ecosystem with Service Cloud Voice, Einstein Bots and Digital Channels, Service Cloud, Field Service, CPQ, MuleSoft, and Einstein Analytics. We are experts in building experiences grounded in data that transform and optimize the employee and customer journey.

What sets NeuraFlash apart?

At NeuraFlash, our people form the core of our business and the soul of our brand. We hire individuals who inspire us and look at challenges as opportunities to create innovative solutions. You‚Äôll be provided with ongoing education and development opportunities via our Salesforce Partnership Program and mentorship programs created for our aspiring leaders. NeuraFlash is on the forefront of cutting-edge technologies and we understand by investing in you, we‚Äôre investing in ourselves!

As the first Product Marketing Manager at NeuraFlash, you will drive go-to-market initiatives for NeuraFlash‚Äôs growing suite of Salesforce AppExchange and Amazon Marketplace products and packages. Utilizing a wide range of marketing techniques in tight collaboration with our VP of Marketing, you will create messaging that drives the opportunity pipeline and promotes our products to existing and potential customers across several industries. In addition, this person will need to stay close with the sales organization and product leadership from our partners, to always have a forward-thinking roadmap in future releases and products to take advantage of the market opportunities and create continuous differentiation for NeuraFlash.¬†

The Product Marketing Manager will be responsible for product launches, GTM strategy, value propositions, videos, demos, customer renewals, awareness, and more.¬†

AS PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER, YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO:¬†

  • Develop go-to-market strategy for new and existing products¬†
  • Ensure our existing and new customers renew their license agreements, take advantage of new features, and add-on additional products from NeuraFlash
  • Train Sales team members on product features¬†
  • Educate and create high awareness of the broader Salesforce, Amazon, and other markets
  • Continue to create differentiation for our products and the NeuraFlash brand
  • Stay close to the sales, CSG, and delivery teams as well as our technology partners
  • Present to executives and stakeholders on product launches and value propositions¬†
  • Understand customers‚Äô needs and challenges and create targeted campaigns and launches
  • Partner with sales, product, and other cross functional teams to drive alignment on new releases¬†
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Driven leader that is excited about the product opportunities with Salesforce/Amazon and others
  • 5+ years of product marketing or product GTM strategy experience
  • Background in Product Marketing or related field within the Salesforce and/or Amazon AWS CRM space
  • Strong ability to identify and utilize customer needs to tell an inspiring story about our product solution¬†
  • Confident presentation and training skills in front of all organizational levels¬†
  • Hands-on experience and willingness to create content strategies and lead their execution
  • Provide leadership and mentorship to the internal NeuraFlash product teams
  • Collaborates well with all of the NeuraFlash key stakeholders across Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Managed Services, and Delivery
  • Build strong relationships with product leadership at Salesforce and Amazon
What‚Äôs it like to be a part of NeuraFlash?
  • Remote & In-Person: Whether you work out of our HQ in Massachusetts, one of our regional hubs, our India office, or you're one of over half of our NeuraFlash Family who work remotely, we‚Äôre focused on keeping everyone connected and unified as one team.
  • Flexibility: Do you have to take the dog to the vet, pick up the kids from school, or the in-laws from the airport? We know that a perfect 9-5 isn‚Äôt possible. So you have to jump out to do any of those, no problem! We build a culture of trust and understanding. We value good work not the hours in which you get it done
  • Collaboration: You have a voice here!¬† If you work with a team of smart people like we do, it‚Äôs a no-brainer to take suggestions and feedback on how to keep NeuraFlash thriving.¬† Our executive team holds town halls & company meetings where they address any suggestions or questions asked, no matter how big or small.
  • Celebrate Often: We take our work seriously, but we don‚Äôt take ourselves too seriously. Whether it is an arm wrestling contest, costume party, or ugly holiday sweaters our teams love to have fun. And while we work hard, we don‚Äôt forget to slow down and celebrate the big things and the small things together.
The ‚ÄúFlashy‚Äù Perks:
  • Be in the right space: Work at the forefront of AI & Innovation on the Salesforce Platform.
  • Growth: In 2021, we grew our team by close to 90%, and we plan to do the same again this year!¬† There‚Äôs no limit to where your career at NeuraFlash can go.
    ¬†
  • L&D Program: We are invested in your success. This program was built to help our employees advance in their career in Salesforce and at NeuraFlash.
  • Mentorship Program: Each new team member is assigned a mentor to help them acclimate at NeuraFlash.
  • Monthly & Weekly Socials: We hold monthly & weekly virtual socials to have more opportunities to be together.
  • Company Retreats: This looks a little different in the age of COVID-19 but we gather the entire company twice a year to share stories & visions for NeuraFlash.¬†¬†

Location: NeuraFlash strives to provide you with the flexibility to work in the location that makes the most sense for your lifestyle. For those that prefer an office setting, this role may be based in any of our hub locations within the United States, India, and British Columbia, Canada. If you prefer to work from your home, we can accommodate remote locations anywhere in the United States for our U.S. based employees, and anywhere within British Columbia for our Canadian employees !

results.title: Software Release Manager
results.description:
Your role


Notability is an industry-leading note taking application with expressive drawing capabilities that make full use of the power of the Apple Pencil and iPad Pro. This is an open role for someone who can join us in continuing to deliver incredible new features that strike a delicate balance between simplicity and power, ensuring that Notability continues to be the best note-taking experience in the world.

We are looking for a release manager to join our app team to help us continuously deliver updates for Notability across iOS and Mac platforms. We strive to consistently deliver new features while maintaining a high quality user experience.

Your responsibilities
  • Solve difficult problems that feature soft real-time performance targets¬†
  • Manage weekly releases to continuously deliver new features and fixes to users on Mac and iOS platforms
  • Mediate between engineering, QA, and product teams to ensure releases are timely and of the highest quality
  • Build and send beta versions of the app to testers via TestFlight

  • Monitor operational issues and crash rates and escalate new or growing issues via the proper channels
  • Deliver hot fix releases if needed in a timely manner

  • Communicate release status effectively to different stakeholders including product, design, support, QA and management
  • Identify bottlenecks with and propose improvements to our release process
Requirements
  • 5+ years of experience.
  • Proven track record with software release management
  • Expertise in git and continuous integrations services such as CircleCI
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to easily collaborate with others
  • Ability to cultivate consensus and alignment within and across teams
  • Value continuous learning, experimentation and improving
    How we Work

    Each member of our team contributes to all parts of our products. We trust each other to make decisions independently while also considering our common goals and values. We share ideas openly, and we collaborate across disciplines to ensure that our decisions make sense from all perspectives.

    When We Work

    We keep work and life balanced. We set our schedules based on our excitement to solve a problem, and we trust each other to get things done. We work from home when it will help, and we have an ‚Äúas long as you get your work done‚Äù vacation policy.

    Where We Work

    We work in downtown SF near Market Street, just a short walk from two BART/Muni stations. Our open-plan office has height-adjustable desks to help us stay limber, a trio of rooms for small group meetings or individual work, and a shuffleboard table to help us stay coordinated (or to enjoy during happy hour :).

    Remote Work

    We are open to full-time remote employees who reside in the U.S.

    Benefits
    • Competitive compensation in form of base salary, bonuses and profit sharing
    • Comprehensive healthcare fully covered for you and your family
    • Flexible work and vacation schedules
    • 401k with matching contributions
    • Matching gifts to non-profits
    • Public transit reimbursement
    • Home workstation reimbursement
    • ISP reimbursement

Qumata unlocks insights into an individual‚Äôs current and future health and mortality risks, for anyone equipped with a smartphone, instantaneously and without medical questionnaires or examinations. We work with life and health insurers to help them create a faster, more customer-centric underwriting journey, providing the extra-mortality, extra-morbidity and other parameters for any individual and for 800 medical conditions.

You will help us revolutionise this industry with a range of clients and partners from small to top-tier Insurers, re-insurers, and MGAs in Europe and APAC.



Job Description

As a Data Scientist at Qumata, you would be supporting the development of our insurance products and leading the transformation of insurance worldwide. The role will require you to push forward the effort to replace the standard life and health insurance questionnaires with Qumata's low friction, data driven process built around the models developed by the data science team.

You will develop the capability and business knowledge, along with the technical skills required to design and implement insightful and engaging data driven solutions for our clients.¬† ¬† You will work to improve upon and develop new model features and output so the team can deliver the best possible products for our clients.¬†

  • Experience coding in Python (essential) and R (preferable)

  • Understanding of ML in production, i.e. version control, testing, model drift, etc.

  • A highly motivated self-starter with solid business acumen and enthusiasm to develop new product

A plus:

  • An in-depth understanding of the actuarial techniques in insurance

  • You have delivered a data product from exploratory data analysis through to production

  • An understanding of insurance and/or health analytics

  • Keen interest in AI and machine learning

  • Ability to work in agile environment

results.title: Payroll Manager
results.description:
Company Description

Since 1940, Dairy Queen¬Æ has been one of the world‚Äôs best known and loved brands. Based in Minneapolis, MN, International Dairy Queen Inc., (IDQ), is the parent company of American Dairy Queen Corporation. As a leading franchisor, there are more than 7,000 independently owned and operated restaurants in the U.S., Canada and more than 20 countries around the world. IDQ is a subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. (Berkshire) which is led by Warren Buffett, the legendary investor and CEO of Berkshire.

Here at IDQ, we create extraordinary Fan experiences every day and we do this through our commitment to hiring and retaining only the best in class talent. We firmly believe that our employees are the catalyst to the success of the company where their initiative, strategic thinking, and entrepreneurial spirit are recognized and rewarded. We're looking for motivated, passionate and dedicated individuals with an inherent need and ambition to go after bigger challenges.



Job Description

We have an exciting opportunity available for a Payroll Manager located at our Corporate headquarters in Bloomington, MN.¬† The Payroll Manager is an individual contributor role that manages¬†the payroll function for International Dairy Queen/ADQ and its subsidiaries including corporate employees in the United States, Canada, and International as well as Corporate Stores employees, ensuring employees are paid on a timely and accurate basis and ensuring compliance with the federal, state and local government requirements.¬† Research and recommend opportunities for best practice operations in the payroll function.

Principle Accountabilities Include:

  • Manage bi-weekly and semi-monthly disbursement of multi-state and international payroll (about 500 employees), including garnishments, benefits and taxes, for all employees and locations consistent with federal and state wage and hour laws.
  • Ensure the processing of new hires, temporary workers, transfers, promotions and terminations is accurate and timely.¬† Ensure systems are set-up and updated to reflect our current employee base, including wages, benefits, sick and vacation time.
  • Critically review and analyze current payroll, benefits and tax procedures in order to recommend and implement changes for best-practice operations. Maintain payroll guidelines by writing and updating policies and procedures.
  • Communicate continuously and openly with HR and appropriate departments to review cross-departmental impacts and reconcile data sharing. ¬†Partner with HR in maintaining a sophisticated payroll and benefits system.
  • Prepare and review payroll journal entries and related general ledger account reconciliations.
  • Ensure all payroll information and records are maintained in accordance with statutory requirements.
  • Manage regular preparation of relevant management reports, including weekly, monthly, quarterly and year-end reports (gross payroll, hours worked, vacation accrual, tax deductions, benefit deductions, etc.).
  • Maintain payroll expertise with payroll regulations through external study and regular networking with payroll professionals.

¬†

results.title: Senior Front End Developer (React)
results.description:
Our Senior Front End Developer will help take our web application and stack to the next level. We're looking for a dynamic engineer who is no stranger to building well-designed, performant and effective front end web applications that support complex business rules. You will start by learning from the experiences of our current team and our current offerings and become intimately familiar with our codebase. As you improve in your understanding of our business logic, you will contribute your front end experience by adding features to our existing web app, which supports thousands of customers.

What You'll Do
  • Contribute to new and existing projects by developing and maintaining a reliable set of edge applications
  • Partner with UX and Product Management to translate complex business flows into friendly UI experiences
  • Build shared microservices that can serve multiples applications and scale independently
  • Enable our team to tap into our valuable data sources and build incredible features for our customers
  • Provide constructive feedback on pull requests to increase code quality
Your First 90 Days

In your First 30 Days,¬†you will immerse yourself in our team, tech stack and development culture. You will work with your Lead to better understand our web app offering. You will help implement our front end technical roadmap, which takes scalability, testing, and performance into account, and present a gap analysis on what can be done even better. You will take on development items, getting your hands in our current web stack (75-90% of your time).¬†

In your First 60 Days,¬†along with user stories and product features, you will help work on a backlog of technical infrastructure work identified in your First 30 Days. You will help drive an efficient and effective SDLC and work to learn and better support your Scrum Team (Product Management, QA, fellow Developers).¬†

In your First 90 Days, you will help instill the discipline of effectively monitoring and creating work items from production issues.¬†You will further our tech stack by continuing to help implement our technical roadmap and future deliveries. You will further play a meaningful role in helping hire future members of our growing Product Team.¬†

Who You Are
  • 5+ years' experience developing single-page web applications
  • Depth of experience with React or other modern front end frameworks (e.g., Angular, Vue)
  • Ability to flesh out user stories to be consumed by the rest of your team
  • Experience working in an Agile environment (e.g., Scrum, Kanban)
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with ability to collaborate with remote team members
  • Excellent technical design, problem-solving and debugging skills
Your Differentiators
  • Prior experience with C# or Java
  • Bachelor's in Computer Science preferred

Our Values

  • We are a Team. Employees, customers, and partners working together.
  • We are Customer-Focused. Customers are the heart of everything we do.
  • We are Driven. Seeking exceptional outcomes.
  • We Own our Success. Every employee has a stake in our company.
  • We do the right thing and have fun in the process.

The salary range for this opportunity is $130,000 - $140,000 per year. You will be eligible for discretionary bonus compensation, subject to plans that may be in effect from time to time. You will further be eligible to participate in Unanet's employee benefits plans and programs. For more details on Unanet's benefits offerings, please visit https://unanet.com/employee-benefits.
